title: Do reports even exist?

replies.body: Lets be honest, what most of you snowflakes call bullying, other people call teaching or sometimes even conversing. Your reports were probably ignored.

I reported someone in fact two players this Monday, so the day before yesterday.

Within 5 minutes i received feedback from riot they issued panelty to the reported player

> [{quoted}](name=Canc,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=choIZecT,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-07-26T01:12:02.168+0000)
>
> I reported someone in fact two players this Monday, so the day before yesterday.
> 
> Within 5 minutes i received feedback from riot they issued panelty to the reported player

Was it for verbal abuse? Because thats the ONLY time I receive feedback. I've reported intent feeders and griefers countless times and NEVER received feedback regarding the outcome. Not ever!

Also that brings me to another question. Since the retarded reporting system cannot detect between someone intent feeding or simply having  a bad game, does that mean if you report them for feeding etc you're report weighting is decreased? As in it thinks you're phantom reporting?

I'd very much like to know the answer to this as it must be pretty fucking complicated considering it's an automated system. My guess is that it doesn't work at all, only in extreme cases such as Tyler1 and I'm sure a Riot staff member would have had a hand in his ban.

I dont think its automated, I think theres admins actually reviewing the report....

Yes, i only report verbal abuse... because only 3 times out 1 year i have seen intentional feeding...

Every other time its just a bad player who cant do much but dying.

The nature of a moba is you meet random, and rarely ever see them again. So when they screwed up in your match, even if you help them out, there is no point. 

A. Low chance to meet them again.
B. You will be vsing them.

Unlike mmorpg, where helping new players on the same side have long term effects. Moba games like league, helping 1 dude that feed during your game is from good will, but pointless. 

So, it easy for team mate to vent their anger on the underperforming player, and yes some take it too far "personal insult etc.."; But those people get 14days ban to permaban very fast, as their reports racking up way faster then a guy that rage out about ingame problems; Example, calling some 1 a nub for having certain items, or play badly. 

I think aslong as the conversation strictly kept to ingame contents, it is fine to rage.
